project.teaser: ZEvRA's main objective is to improve the circularity of light-duty EVs throughout their entire value chain, from materials supply and manufacturing to end-of-life (EoL) processes, which aligns with the European Union's goal of achieving zero CO2e emissions by 2035...
project.objective: ZEvRA's main objective is to improve the circularity of light-duty EVs throughout their entire value chain, from materials supply and manufacturing to end-of-life (EoL) processes, which aligns with the European Union's goal of achieving zero CO2e emissions by 2035, particularly in the EV value chain. To do so, ZEvRA will develop a Design for Circularity (DfC) methodology and a holistic circularity assessment aimed at improving the production of electric vehicles (EVs) based on the 9Rs. This methodology will be validated by developing zero emission solutions for the most important automotive materials, covering > 84% material mix: steel, three versions of aluminium (wrought, casting, and foam), thermoplastics composites (long and continuous fibre-reinforced), unfiled/short fibre plastics, glass, tyres and Rare Earth Elements (REE). These solutions will be supported by a set of digital tools to support the manufacturing of the use cases, the assessment of circularity, traceability, and the virtual integration of components into a full replicable vehicle. To maximise the outreach of our methodology and zero emission solutions, ZEvRA will develop a dedicated training & upskilling programme for the automotive workforce and academia, together with activities aimed at increasing awareness & acceptability of the proposed zero emission solutions. Lastly, circular business models targeting EoL and logistics aimed at improving the economic feasibility of circularity in EVs are advanced. ZEvRA’s innovations aim to improve zero emission approaches in the life cycle and value chain of at least 59% of European EVs by 2035 through the 5 OEMs and Tier 1’s that are part of the consortium, which includes industry and academia covering the entire automotive value chain.
project.title: Zero Emission electric Vehicles enabled by haRmonised circulArity

article.title: Zero emission solution for electric vehicle value chains

result.title: Innovation and Data Management Plan (DMP) with open science practices, gender dimension and ethics (first version)
result.description: First version of the Data Management Plan (DMP). Open sciences and data management plan; Protecting the data while they are being collected, processed, analysed, and backed-up; Ensuring that data obeys with legal regulations, gender and ethical considerations; Regular reporting to the consortium; Monitoring and evaluating database performance; Improving the technology used building new databases.

result.title: Preliminary definition of the Circularity assessment
result.description: The report includes the Preliminary definition of the Circularity assessment as a basis for the baseline analyses.

result.title: Impact of die design and bearing geometry on grain size and PCG formation during extrusion of AA6082 aluminum alloy

details.authors: Marco Negozio, Sara di Donato, Riccardo Pelaccia, Adrian H․A․ Lutey, Daniele Carosi, Barbara Reggiani, Alessandro Morri, Lorenzo Donati

result.title: Risk management plan (first version)
result.description: The first version of the risk management plan contains quality procedures that will be used throughout the project. This plan is based on the preliminary identified risks and is monitored regularly. The plan includes the definition and updating of metrics to assess the quality of the realised solutions, a risk assessment plan to identify potential deviations or setbacks during the project and to prepare recovery actions if necessary.

result.title: Scientific and technical management guidelines
result.description: The report contains guidelines for the scientific and technical monitoring activities and plans to monitor technical achievements, ensure achievement of objectives, work with the coordinator to address objectives, plans, progress, related problems, proposals and recommendations.

result.title: Risk management plan (second version)
result.description: The second version of the risk management. This plan is based on the preliminary identified risks and is monitored regularly. The plan includes the definition and updating of metrics to assess the quality of the realized solutions, a risk assessment plan to identify potential deviations or setbacks during the project and to prepare recovery actions if necessary.

result.title: Project identity: brand, marketing basics and website
result.description: set-up of the project website, logo and marketing material

result.title: Harmonized design Inception report: roles mapping, methodological framework and workshop’s dynamics
result.description: The report includes the DfC methodology with its 4 steps for the applications in the ZEvRA project. It defines the specific working groups and a series of workshops using interactive platforms and different tools and methods, e.g. the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP), to define the iteration process between material experts, designers and end users (all participants).

result.title: Evaluating the Circularity of Computer-Aided Design Models: A Systematic Literature Review

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
